rbiom 1.0.2.9037

Make a distance matrix of samples vs samples.

Source: R/beta.div.r
beta.div.Rd

Make a distance matrix of samples vs samples.

beta.div(
  biom,
  method,
  weighted = TRUE,
  tree = NULL,
  long = FALSE,
  md = FALSE,
  safe = FALSE
)

Arguments

biom

A matrix, simple_triplet_matrix, or BIOM object, as returned from read.biom. For matrices, the rows and columns are assumed to be the taxa and samples, respectively.
method

The distance algorithm to use. Options are: manhattan, euclidean, bray-curtis, jaccard, and unifrac. Non-ambiguous abbreviations of the method names are also accepted. A phylogenetic tree must be present in biom or explicitly provided via tree= to use the UniFrac methods.
weighted

Take relative abundances into account. When weighted=FALSE, only presence/absence is considered.
tree

A phylo object representing the phylogenetic relationships of the taxa in biom. Will be taken from the tree embedded in the biom object if not explicitly specified. Only required for computing UniFrac distance matrices.
long

Pivot the returned data to long format?

FALSE

Return a dist object. (Default)

TRUE

A data.frame with columns "Sample1", "Sample2" and "Distance" is returned.
md

Include metadata in the output data frame? Options are:

FALSE

Don't include metadata. (Default)

TRUE

Include all metadata.

character vector

Include only the specified metadata columns. Column names can be prefixed with == or != to indicate that only within or between groupings, respectively, are to be kept. See examples below.
safe

Should autogenerated columns be prefixed with a "." to avoid conflicting with metadata column names? (Default: FALSE)

Value

If both long and md are FALSE, returns a distance matrix, otherwise a data.frame.

Examples

    library(rbiom)
    
    biom <- select(hmp50, 1:10)
    dm <- beta.div(biom, 'unifrac')
    as.matrix(dm)[1:4,1:4]

#>           HMP01     HMP02     HMP03     HMP04
#> HMP01 0.0000000 0.1950253 0.3687298 0.4239831
#> HMP02 0.1950253 0.0000000 0.2101679 0.3187533
#> HMP03 0.3687298 0.2101679 0.0000000 0.3040937
#> HMP04 0.4239831 0.3187533 0.3040937 0.0000000
    plot(hclust(dm))

    
    # Return in long format with metadata
    biom <- select(hmp50, 18:21)
    beta.div(biom, 'unifrac', md = c("Body Site", "Sex"))

#>    Sample1 Sample2  Distance       Body Site            Sex
#> 5    HMP18   HMP19 0.6651627 Saliva vs Stool Female vs Male
#> 9    HMP18   HMP20 0.6810017 Saliva vs Stool Female vs Male
#> 10   HMP19   HMP20 0.4183059           Stool         Female
#> 13   HMP18   HMP21 0.7170374 Saliva vs Stool           Male
#> 14   HMP19   HMP21 0.3896741           Stool Female vs Male
#> 15   HMP20   HMP21 0.1490926           Stool Female vs Male
    
    # Only look at distances among the stool sample
    beta.div(biom, 'unifrac', md = c("==Body Site", "Sex"))

#>    Sample1 Sample2  Distance Body Site            Sex
#> 10   HMP19   HMP20 0.4183059     Stool         Female
#> 14   HMP19   HMP21 0.3896741     Stool Female vs Male
#> 15   HMP20   HMP21 0.1490926     Stool Female vs Male
    
    # Or between males and females
    beta.div(biom, 'unifrac', md = c("Body Site", "!=Sex"))

#>    Sample1 Sample2  Distance       Body Site            Sex
#> 5    HMP18   HMP19 0.6651627 Saliva vs Stool Female vs Male
#> 9    HMP18   HMP20 0.6810017 Saliva vs Stool Female vs Male
#> 14   HMP19   HMP21 0.3896741           Stool Female vs Male
#> 15   HMP20   HMP21 0.1490926           Stool Female vs Male
